name: Jollof rice with chicken
ingridients:
300g/10½oz basmati rice
1 tbsp vegetable oil
8 boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut in half
1 onion, roughly chopped
3 garlic cloves, grated
5cm/2 in piece fresh root ginger, peeled and finely grated
1 red chilli,
deseeded and finely chopped
1 tsp smoked paprika
2 tbsp tomato purèe
700ml/1¼ pint tomato passata
300ml/10fl oz chicken stock, from a cube
2 red peppers, deseeded and roughly chopped
2 tbsp roughly chopped fresh coriander
freshly ground black pepper
method:
1.Tip the basmati rice into a large bowl and cover with cold water. Set aside.
2.Heat the oil in a large lidded sautè pan, add the chicken thighs and fry on each side for 1–2 minutes, or until just golden brown. Push the chicken to one side, add the onion and cook for 3–4 minutes, or until just softened but not coloured.
3.Stir the chicken back into the onions, then add the garlic, ginger, chilli and smoked paprika and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato purèe and mix well.
4.Drain the rice and stir it into the chicken mixture. Add the tomato passata and half the stock. Stir well and bring to a simmer. Cover with a lid and cook gently over a medium-low heat for 15 minutes, or until the liquid has nearly been absorbed.
5.Stir the rice well, then add the remaining stock and stir once more. Scatter the peppers over the top of the rice, return the lid to the pan and cook for another 5 minutes, or until all the liquid has been absorbed and the rice and peppers are tender. (If the rice is not quite done, cook for a further 5 minutes.) Season with pepper, stir through in the coriander and serve.

name: Easy chicken fajitas
ingridients:
6 flour tortillas
2 chicken breasts, cut into strips
2 garlic cloves, finely chopped
½ tsp ground cumin
1 tsp chilli powder
1 lime, juice only
2 tbsp olive oil
1 red onion, thinly sliced
2 peppers, preferably different
colours, thinly sliced
salt and freshly ground black pepper
